items.title: Everytime I travel to Hereford delays…
items.review_text: Everytime I travel to Hereford delays delays delays , and a bus ride to nowhere transport for Wales are a joke avoid if you can at all costs they are depressingly awful and they have become a laughing stock terrible company.....

items.title: Profit before Safety
items.review_text:
Why is it that the TFW company only ever put on 2 coaches at peak hours for journeys between Cardiff and Merthyr Tydfil.

Numerous times the 2 carriages are rammed full of commuters who have to stand for extremely long periods. 

Then they have to try their best to balance as the train stops or pulls off. 

Surely they have a spare carriage somewhere 

This must be a H&S issue

items.title: Transport for Wales is a great example…
items.review_text: Transport for Wales is a great example of how government can mess everything up. A single carriage is not a train and even when there’s more there is never enough carriages ever. How many taxpayers pounds have been funnelled into this shocking service?

items.title: Woefully poor
items.review_text:
If it were a school or hospital it would be put in special messures and if I could put 0 stars I would.
No updates when trains are cancelled or delayed, we got an update from a tfw employee who was commuting

items.title: Utterly shocking company
items.review_text: Utterly shocking company. Merthyr line has been overcrowded and unreliable for years yet TFW do nothing. They're more than happy to overcharge for a dreadful service though

items.title: Serious overcrowding and standing room only.
items.review_text: I caught the 1508 from Port Talbot to Cardiff and it was standing all the way. There were about 40 people standing in the rear of 2 coaches and about 20 in the  front coach. The train was from Milford Haven to Manchester and clearly it needed another coach at least. I cannot think that Monday afternoon is a busy time - it must be much worse at peak hours and weekends. Thought not the fault of TfW it was disappointing that  none of the young gave up their seats for some elderly women who clearly deserved a seat. Courtesy and kindness was very much absent.

items.title: Train late as usual
items.review_text:
Train late as usual 
Too few carriages as usual 
However excessive loud announcements are horrendous- would someone from tfw please tell me why 6 loud announcements between stations which annoys everyone on board are necessary

items.title: Caught 11.52 train from Pontyclun to…
items.review_text:
Caught 11.52 train from Pontyclun to Cardiff 12th April, 2024.  As our “esteemed” WAG is continually urging us to use public transport we thought we would try to be public spirited. 

Couldn’t get machine to work at station but at least we could get on and plenty of room in carriage (two carriage  train). Waited to purchase a ticked on board.  Saw two young railway staff on board chatting to each other at entrance/exit doors. Then saw ticket collector ( yes it WAS a ticket collector) stroll past to join them, collecting no fares on the way.  I tried to get his attention but the three continued chatting, totally ignored me. Relatively short journey so by the time we reached Cardiff the ticket collector had disappeared down the train!!! I asked the 2 remaining staff what I could do about a ticket. Had a metaphorical shrug with the reply “we’re only here to watch doors and see to passengers, not deal with tickets “!  I asked why the ticket collector didn’t collect the fare from my husband and myself .  The response - “he was too busy and it was too crowded , you’ll have to pay when you get off”.  Absolute rubbish!! it was NOT busy, our carriage was about half full. Most of the time in that short journey the ticket collector spent chatting to the other two railway staff, totally ignoring the passengers. 

We then had to join a long queue to pay for our fares.  All because one of your staff couldn’t be bothered to carry out his job.  Perhaps your, probably very handsomely paid, staff should do the job they are paid for.  May make for efficiency and customer satisfaction.  Unfortunately,  judging from the rest of the reviews, that doesn’t seem to be TFW highest priority!    


Update - As can be from TFW (Holly) reply, “they care about their staff and won’t discuss them online” My complaint was in essence about the general decline in staff attitude towards passengers.  Viewing them as a nuisance and an inconvenience.  Perhaps TFW should start caring about their customers as well as their staff!!

items.title: The Oxford dictionary should be updated…
items.review_text: The Oxford dictionary should be updated to define the word ineptitude as 'Transport for Wales'. No regard to the community which they serve. Over an hour late to work today due to an "operational incident". Nonsensical procedure prevails over common sense. Cease operations and hand the contract over to someone who can fulfill their obligations.

items.title: AWFUL SERVICE-worse response and dont try to use contact centre as they dont know and refer you to station staff.Also dont ask to speak to Communication Director as "he doesnt speak to customers"
items.review_text: Complete shambles-service from Aberystwyth regularly replaced by buses with no information at the station as the only staff are in the booking office at its not their job to advice unless asked.Departure board shows train cancelled when a replacement bus is sitting away from the station with no info provided and dont contact customer service and they are worse than useless.

items.title: Efficiency need to be improved
items.review_text:
I bought 3 First class tickets from Manchester Piccadilly to Cardiff Central, departed at 1030 on 2 December 2023. Unfortunately, the train had only two carriages and didn’t have first class service provided so I had to refund the difference between the First Class and Standard Class fare. The customer service was very responsive and promise will refund it. However, There has been no response from them since. I tried to ask it but sill no response. 2 months already. 
 TfWRS-20231204-H9L9P3

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text: Horrible service, constantly late. The one train i get an hour is almost constantly cancelled without an explanation or even being told why. And that’s on top of the ever increasing insane prices. they need to get their act together

items.title: I’ve had no option but to use TFW the…
items.review_text: I’ve had no option but to use TFW the last two days after not using for 6 months (brought a second vehicle because trains are so shambolic). Sad to say it’s still just as shambolic and useless as before. Late, overcrowded, expensive, useless.

items.title: Over full trains
items.review_text:
Over full trains - only 2 carriages in rush hour periods in Cardiff centre. People squashed into very little space or left standing on platforms for another ‘over full’ train to arrive. Discriminatory against many passengers such as those with additional needs and people with pushchairs.
This happens nearly every week day.

items.title: Constantly late. Super expensive.
items.review_text: Constantly late. Super Expensive. I can’t understand why our train network is SO poor compared to other countries I’ve visited! I wouldn’t mind being late every now and again if I wasn’t paying £9 a return! And then they have the cheek (in a cost of living crisis!) to tell us they’re raising their prices on the 1st of March!? Disgusting. Robbing. It’s actually cheaper for me to drive to work daily, however as I only have 1 car sometimes my partner needs it. It may be cheaper to get a 2nd car soon 🤷🏻‍♂️

items.title: A joke!
items.review_text: Transport for Wales. Have just looked up time to get from Flint to Cardiff by train. Journey time between 3hrs 14mins and 4hrs 7mins. London to Cardiff journey time just under 2hrs. I used to travel regularly between Aberystwyth and Bournemouth and it was a joke. Staff very pleasant, awful overcrowded trains and I've lost count of the number of times I claimed my fare back because trains were cancelled or delayed by over an hour. The worst experience ever!

items.title: Shambolic Tfw
items.review_text: Just thought I would give the newbridge to Cardiff line a go sat 23rd after the new line is up and running but I must say what a complete shambles still even months after my first review, two stops only from Ebbw Vale and  the 2 carriages packed already a joke service tfw. Everybody should go to Ystrad Mynach where there's 4 trains an hour which is where I will be going from now on. Please customer services don't send me a politicians response of scripted bull the service isn't improving and even speaking to one of the employees they agree the office aren't listening to them either, as I stated in a previous review any private company would have their licence removed for such a bad service are they actually reading customers reviews. Also one of the younger customers stated they go to Ebbw Vale college through the week with 3 carriages on and the train is empty you can't make it up!

items.title: The past three years
items.review_text: The past three years, we have had the closure of Barmouth Bridge for three monthly  intervals,  total, twelve months of closures in total. As  the Barmouth bridge has been renovated. The line reopened late December.. we have a train service which only runs once every two hours. Services are constantly being cancelled.. Which means every train cancelled, means a further 2 hour wait for the next one. Even a third world country has a better rail service. There again citizens in this part of Wales, have always  been treated as third class citizens by TFW  the Welsh government.

items.title: Appalling … just 2 carriages from…
items.review_text: Appalling … just 2 carriages from Cardiff to Manchester - totally overcrowded. From other reviews this has been complained about for at least 3 years … yet they are still totally under providing capacity for the service. Customers are paying considerable fares for a shabby service on which they are fortunate to be able to squeeze onboard - seats are a pipe dream. Please wake up to the issue Transport for Wales - your service is scandalous!

items.title: 1 Star is Generous
items.review_text: What's not to love about Transport for Fails? Whether it's being lucky to stand up on a train because they refuse to put more carriages on, trains being 30+ minutes late or cancelled, despite the station listing the train as being on time, with no reason, or extremely poor reasons for the delays/cancellations being given, the fact that you can't open a window on half of their trains, their latest scam of giving you the option to buy a first class ticket, despite most of the trains not offering a first class area, the bully boy ticket inspectors that appear when they can be bothered to send them to the station, the train having 2 toilets, both of which are out of order, the person who wheels a paltry offering of snacks and drinks down the train (although often this service is not offered), the insistence on having automated announcements made in both Welsh and English (even when travelling through England), there's something for everybody with Transport for Fails!

items.title: No such thing as 1st class
items.review_text: Booked 1st class ticket, no first class carriage. No lap tables, no charging points. I was travelling from Manchester piccalilli to Newport. 3hrs without any facilities are a joke!!!

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: Appalling. I've bought a ticket for a train which doesn't exist. The app isn't fit for purpose and they lock down their M Tickets into it so you have no choice but to try to use it even though it's broken nonsense. Total, uninterrupted, end to end incompetence.

items.title: I love travelling on TfW - contrasts so clearly with Avanti!
items.review_text: I love travelling on TfW. It's a delight. North coast route is my usual. The workers seem happy, are friendly and helpful. Staff are well dressed. Trains are clean. Most importantly they are reliable and always on time. When I have to transfer to Avanti for travel to London I hate it! The contrast is massive. Grumpy unhelpful staff and trains ALWAYS cancelled! Please keep TfW and expand it!

items.title: I would give a minus star review but…
items.review_text: I would give a minus star review but there isn’t an option to do that. The service is so bad I actually sometimes consider leaving Wales and living elsewhere. I travel twice a month for work and what should be a simple 3 hour journey consistently takes up to 6 hours of misery. Endless last minute cancellations, poor communication, even rail staff don’t seem to know what’s happening. And to add insult to injury the ticket cost is nearly £100 a time. The repay compensation scheme seldom works and so I don’t even get my money back. Can it really be so difficult to run a train company? It’s 2023. We send astronauts to moon, satellites through space, have the technology for AI…it’s so depressing we can’t even run a couple of train lines.

items.title: This company its a joke
items.review_text:
This company its a joke. Services are really bad. Train cancellation very often. Very expensive tickets for a s***t services. People travel like animals. this company never provide enough coaches. The Chester - Bangor journey is probably the most disgusting.

Jo D

items.title: The staff are great but...
items.review_text: The staff are great - just want to say that off the bat. However, the trains are a mess. There were tales of investment in new trains and, indeed, some of them look different but I presume the person in charge of purchasing the new fleet did so on Facebook Marketplace or perhaps Wish. Taking TfW is a lottery with a win being only a 15-30 minute delay and a more common occurrence being a complete breakdown. Sadly, you're better off driving which I regret saying given there are already too many cars on the road. Please pay the train maintenance staff more/employ more people or whatever it takes to make them work...

items.title: Unsafe, overcrowded and unapologetic
items.review_text: TFW why do you sell tickets if you don’t have the capacity for the amount of travellers? People are crammed in like sardines and are told to move in more and more to make room for passengers to just about squeeze on the absolute joke of a train journey. Totally unsafe. Paying for an expensive ticket shouldn’t mean travelling for hours pressed against someone’s back.

items.title: I travelled from Chester to Llandudno…
items.review_text: I travelled from Chester to Llandudno Junction about 8.30pm on Saturday, 16th December. Totally unacceptable and unsafe how busy the train was with only two carriages on the last main weekend before Christmas. It is not an excuse to say trains are running low on crew. You are not prioritising safety. Many drunk people on the train, and I had to stand up almost all through the journey yet still expected to pay! You will lose your licence at this rate. This is not happening as a one off but constantly.

items.title: TFW should be re-named Transport for Cardiff
items.review_text: The company should be re-named "Transport for Cardiff" as there are no improvements certainly west of Cardiff. Manchester trains from Swansea and West Wales are quite often two and at the most three carriage trains, totally inadequate for the passenger numbers. The services that di run quite often get terminated short of Manchester causing all sorts of problems. Clueless can only describe this Mickey Mouse train company.

items.title: TFW give yourself a pat on the back.
items.review_text:
Today I travelled across country from Scunthorpe in the East to Bangor in the West changing trains in Stockport and Chester. The first leg was with the Trans Pennine Express which mostly travelled at about 20 mph and was freezing cold. The second leg was with the Northern line which was very similar and definitely just as cold.

To be fair both ran on time and were spot on. I arrived in Chester, had time for a coffee and a sandwich at the station cafe and got on the train for Bangor. Beautifully warm and fairly whizzed along the stunning North Wales coastline. What a beautiful journey. Every station looked well cared for and I saw no litter whatsoever along the route. Refreshments available on the train too if required. All the young  staff were corteous and polite. What's not to like. Well done TFW. Diolch o galon am ddangos sut y dylai pethau i fod.

items.title: Horrendously over-crowded
items.review_text: I dont usually bother to leave reviews but I was so appalled by recent overcrowding on a long distance TfW train - after another similar experience previously - that I feel I should warn others. The train today from Hereford to Newport probably had as many passengers standing, as there were seated, for a journey of nearly an hour. We really were packed in like sardines. When the train arrived at stations it was complete chaos and quite unsafe, as passengers attempted to get on and off, old folks, young families, scrambling over baggage and squeezing through the crush. Avoid at all costs!

items.title: Packed like animals and terrible (the worst) app.
items.review_text:
- train between Cardiff and Aberdare is always over-capacity, very unsafe and a pickpocket’s dream.
- awful app that doesn’t support Apple Wallet (what in the world?!)

I had high hopes for public sector rail, they’ve not been met.

items.title: Absolutely rubbish
items.review_text:
Awful cramped train, only 2 carriages, poor wifi, and no refreshments for sale.

Spent 6 hours between Haverfordwest west with cramped up legs attempting to work with hopeless wifi and no elbow space

Just needed chickens flying around cabin and people travelling sat on the roof to complete the third world experience

items.title: Bit of a shambles
items.review_text: Bit of a shambles. Last 4 times I’ve tried to use the Wrexham to Bidston line in the last 5 weeks the outgoing train has been delayed albeit only about 10 mins on average but the return has been cancelled or heavily delayed - average wait time has been around 2 hours. No information at all, confused TFW staff at Bidston station looking embarrassed.

items.title: One star is generous
items.review_text:
One star is generous. Trains are never on time - I’ve yet to get on one that is. There are never enough carriages and on that note, when trains are busy there should also be announcements advising passengers that unless they’ve paid for their bag to have its very own seat, they should remove it. TFW can’t be responsible for the selfishness of others, but having a pre-recorded announcement lessens the need for passengers to confront others. 

Trustpilot asks for date of experience: Take your pick between 1999 (when I started using the local trains) and Sep 2023! Regardless of ownership, nothing has changed.

items.title: TFW a joke
items.review_text: Seriously over crowded trains .One and two carriages totally unacceptable, when even TFW app says that the services on Saturdays are going too be busy. And to rub passengers noses in it .7 Brand new Stadler trains , parked up at their Lekwith depot .

items.title: Replacement bus scheduled did not show
items.review_text:
Rail replacement bus was set to operate from Llanrwst to Llandudno. They weren't affected by train strike. That bus failed to show.
I've been reading the last few from others, which are all negative.
TfW, as a train operator, this is the last straw. Stuff your ******** Metro plans. There is a lot needs doing to your train services. If you can't make your operations more reliable, you are not helping either local residents or visitors. Run your bleeding trains, if you say you're going to run them. Review passengers needs and put on more carriages where needed. Get faulty trains serviced immediately so they are available when needed.

items.title: Always there’s faults on trains and…
items.review_text: Always there’s faults on trains and have to be on the train for hours until it gets fixed. Worst service ever.

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text: Caught a TfW train. No exaggeration, if you want a third world country experience, use TfW. Cattle class I would call it. If you want standing room only for a two hour journey, use TfW. Worst train experience in my life. Trains in Cambodia are better than this company.

items.title: Ticket man
items.review_text: Ticket guy was disrespectful and rude, told me to f off, asked me if I was thick and threw my ticket at me. Ticket cost £3.60 but charged me £5.90 for something about an advanced ticket, but it’s the same distance.

items.title: Worst service ever with daily delays , cancellation
items.review_text: Worst service ever, worst excuses and reasons daily for serious delays. Always a signal or a freight train was Infront of us, literally 1 time out of 10 a train is on time. Totally unacceptable and they get away with it because people have to work. Disgusting they can even call this a service it's pot luck . What's the probability of TFW train turning up, let alone being prompt . Something needs to be done about this , they are taking a lot of money off customers for a seriously sub standard service. This has been happening every day for past month

items.title: Delayed,Late as usual
items.review_text:
Delayed,Late as usual. Train started it's journey late,arrived at Wrexham late,spent just over a minute waiting for the doors to open,spent three minutes waiting for the doors to close,toilets out of order.

Fix your trains and the management.

When I have a train to take from Chester to London that only allows 6 mins to change at Chester, because your trains are so unreliable and useless ,I take a taxi from Wrexham to Chester.

Best option,adding up the cost of parking at Wrexham general ,the threat of missing my connection at Chester ,take a taxi to Chester .

items.title: Not reliable
items.review_text:
Not reliable. I haven't had a journey this year that has been on time if not cancelled. -multiple occasions and again this morning.

- in response to the reply about refunds ect... It's not about the money. It's about your incapability to provide the service you claim to and advertise to supply. 

Getting my £12 money back - if I am even entitled to a refund it honestly doesn't make up for the hassle or missed opportunities. You're not reliable as a transport Service. I said I what I said. Taking a star off because what a crap reply -  apologizing for my feed back?!  You should have apologized for the delays and failure to operate efficiently.

items.title: Absolutley horrible lady on the bristol…
items.review_text: Absolutley horrible lady on the bristol temple meads train complaing about a rail card when i clearly had a valid rail card. She waved rhe card reader in my face forcing me to buy a new ticket, in the end i gave up argueing and paid the £2 difference. Still dont understand what the issue was.

items.title: No trains running from ammanford to…
items.review_text: No trains running from ammanford to Swansea today.on phoning we were told and on board at station,thst a replacement bus would come.waited 25 minutes and didnt turn up.so we had to get a taxi to get us to swansea on time for paddington train.yet yesterday bus turned up for my son.also told him buscwas at llandovery on the way.but today they had no link.so panicky so stressful and expensive.horrible feeling just waiting and nothing!

items.title: Absolutely shocking that they're even…
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking that they're even allowed to operate a business. Always late, usually cancelled last minute, or the train is replaced with a bus service that's not much better. Having lived in North Wales my whole life, I'm absolutely fed up of the public transport on offer. It's bad enough that the busses hardly ever run anymore but you're lucky to get a train at all from my town these days. My most recent trip, nearly two months ago now, was cancelled literally minutes before it was due to arrive and after going through the tedious process of requesting a refund they're still processing my request. If a service has been paid for and is not provided then a refund is rightly owed.

items.title: Forward Planning too much to ask? ?
items.review_text: Sell out crowd for Wales football, Blondie doing a gig, Peter Kay performing all in one night in Cardiff so you would think extra carriages, possibly extra trains. But no ...dangerous overcrowding in Newport due to cancelled or delayed trains and jammed train on way back and that was before the last train.  Please TFW plan ahead!@

items.title: They'd Struggle to Organise a Paper Round.
items.review_text:
They'd struggle to organise a paper round let alone public transport. 

Abysmal Wi-fi, dirty, late, and indifferent to passengers.

The train staff are generally great, that's about the only good thing that can be said.

Genius idea getting all these private profit-motivated companies to run our national public transport systems.

items.title: TFW is an absolute s**t show
items.review_text: TFW is an absolute s**t show. I have lived in wales for 14 years and over that time the train services have been steadily unreliable with absolutely abysmal service. There is always an issue with the trains and although they are always cancelled for “works” they never seem to improve and stay unreliable and useless

items.title: trains are constantly beeing cancelled…
items.review_text: trains are constantly beeing cancelled and for bs reasons. people relay on your service and. you dont give a care. now 40mins behind just getting back and relaxing. and more and more delays

items.title: As usual TFW FAILS
items.review_text:
As usual TFW FAILS, what I would like is very easy to achieve stop overcrowding trains and when the train is running late be honest about it. -6 weather today train was running 7 mins late so I set of 5 mins later than I usually do. Got to the station and now 20 mins late getting to 27 in total - not a massive issue if you had told me I would have stayed home and warm.
Least I got to warm up in the massively over crowded train

items.title: Alright
items.review_text: Generally in terms of delays, and when compared to companies such as Avanti, it is a fairly decent company. Staff are always kind and fairly helpful. My only negative feedback is a lack of coaches on trains and lack of service on some lines.

items.title: Useless, Unreliable Service
items.review_text: What a useless, unreliable ‘service’. Train cars cut down from four to two at Chester. Due to leave at 8:27pm. Staff arrive at 8:26pm and finally let passengers in. Train was to arrive in Shrewsbury at 21:40h. Instead at 8:39pm we were advised by staff that the train was stopping at Crewe and everyone was to get off and find alternative trains. Two train departures from Crewe south were cancelled meaning the next train was an hours wait. Staff indifferent. No food services at all at Crewe (incl. vending machines). A complete joke, especially with the exorbitant fares they charge.

items.title: Let the train cause mental health issues!@
items.review_text: Unfortunately I have to use them regularly for trips from Welshpool to London. I can count on one hand the number of successful journeys. Late or cancelled no explanation. I am told there is a help point at Welshpool station. Where? The ticket machine was out of operation for over a week.  You claim compensation for delays and they tell you it was not their train!! No wonder ministers think the service is improving they are told lies.  Try using it.  Forgot to mention packed carriages because no stock or the farse of a change over at Shrewsbury!!

items.title: Just awful !!
items.review_text: Never usually write reviews but this service is pathetic ! Have had to come to Abergavenny a lot recently and there are always delays on this service. Also they only put on one or two carriages so it’s always crowded. I have to get the train from Abergavenny station and now that we are in October it is cold however the waiting room is locked with no explanation as to why. I have just passed my driving test so I will luckily never have to use this sorry excuse for a rail service ever again

items.title: Appalling, shocking, despicable .. need I go on??
items.review_text: Unfortunately you have to select 1 star but this shambles of a company does not deserve anything.  They are the worst company ever, delays, dirty trains, overcrowding trains that don’t turn up .. they are an embarrassment  for Wales; but then what should we expect from a service owned by Welsh Govt who are just a shocking bunch of fools. Tried to get from caldicot to Chepstow but delayed, delayed, delayed, delayed. Announcement just kept adding the minutes until the next one due.  Use TFW at your peril !!!!

items.title: Dirty Carriages. Please Clean at Weekends!
items.review_text: Sat on a two hour journey from Newport to Shrewsbury and the train carriage was in a disgusting state! Rubbish left down nearly every seat row and one of the chairs had a wet substance dripping from the pull-down table. It looks like it hasn't been cleaned all weekend! Grateful for the large luggage rack by the door but please do something about the litter.

items.title: Completely unreliable service
items.review_text: Honestly it is IMPOSSIBLE to plan your daily life around the service TfW provides. I have frequently been left waiting on cold platforms for 30+ minutes during winter. Trains are consistently late, and sometimes commuter trains are just cancelled without any rail replacement. How am I supposed to get to work? How is anyone supposed to be able to rely on this service? The only other option is 1.5 hours on the bus, at a similar price, and is equally if not more unreliable. This morning when I left for work everything was running on time, yet when I checked online my train was running almost 50 minutes late. I have had to cancel an appointment I have had for months, all because TfW cannot provide a timely service. Pay your staff properly, sort out your tardiness, and show some damn pride in the service you supposedly provide.

items.title: Premier train Brokedown at Craven Arms…
items.review_text: Premier train Brokedown at Craven Arms from Hollyhead to Cardiff ,Stranded for 3 hrs in the middle of nowhere ,put us on a coach to Cardiff ,arrived at 3am in the morning,had to wait in the Freezing cold until the station opened up at 4am i said hey i suppose to be going to Swansea Charge hand said nobody said anything 🤣 got home at 05.30am instead of 10.30pm the precious day 🙈 Who the hell is in charge of TFW ??? You need to sort things out Mate 😭😭😭😭

items.title: Seen incapable of putting a decent…
items.review_text:
Seen incapable of putting a decent amount of carriages on the route I take your lucky to actually get on the train and this is a daily occurrence been like this for over a year. 

Constant cancellations and when the replacement services are on they put mini buses on and break the law by having people pack into them and stand too. 

They really need a government intervention

items.title: Worst train company in UK
items.review_text: One star is far too generous.   Easily the worst train operator in the UK.  A generally pathetic and chaotic service.  So disorganised it would be funny if it wasn't fir the fact it is incredibly dangerous at times.  Constant cancellations and subsequent very late and dangerously overcrowded trains.  Staff at stations are totally disinterested,  Newport Station is a total bloody shambles.  Honestly there is nothing good to say....worse than Arriva and that really is saying something.   Let First or another actual transport company have a go please!

items.title: Between the numerous strikes
items.review_text: Between the numerous strikes, the constant rail repairs, and some unexplained missing times. The trip from Treherbert to Cardiff is always impacted the worse. Even when the abysmal service does run, it is always overcrowded and little intervention on teenage passengers vaping and sitting on the table. Bad service across the board.

items.title: Train service doesn't use trains
items.review_text:
Replacement bus service to cover the lack of trains is unfit for purpose.

I had to pick my partner up from from Trehafod as the driver refused to stop at, or near Pontypridd after taking the wrong turning.

Driver also missed their previous stops at Radyr and Taffs Well.

Nothing about how TfW is run is fit for service.

items.title: If there was zero stars they’d get that…
items.review_text: If there was zero stars they’d get that … absolute joke of a service, worst in the U.K. and I’ve travelled on some so called bad examples but nothing as bad as this.   1 train every 2 hours north to mid wales … 2 carriages full to bursting.   Cancellations with a rail replacement bus also running 1.5 hrs late… if the Welsh government say there’s an option for public transport in Wales instead of cars it’s a lie.  Every household in north and mid wales needs at least 1 car.   They’ve also decided to stop spending on road improvements & wonder why the accident rate is as high as it is… this Welsh government has got Wales firmly on a race to the bottom transport wise… a transport system run as a nationalised concern by a government … both unfit for purpose

items.title: You would think a rail replacement…
items.review_text:
You would think a rail replacement service would run at the same time as the train it's supposed to be replacing, but that would be far too logical right?

Rather than pumping money into this company, why not help out the far more reliable service buses that I will be using instead in future, if they're not having to cut more routes due to being ignored in favour of funding for the failing TFW...a sorry advertisement for nationalisation sadly.

items.title: Worst Train Service I’ve Ever Experienced
items.review_text: Visiting from London to see family in Abergavenny, every experience I’ve had with the trains to and around the area have been absolutely awful. I’m in shock that this is what is delivered from a country that doesn’t constitute as third-world. The people in charge should lose their jobs, and maybe the surplus cash could be used to get an extra carriage on every train.

items.title: Dreadful trains
items.review_text:
My son moved to Swansea a year ago and the train to wales from wilmslow is like being in a third world country.
I am a pensioner and I have had to stand for four hours on this train as they only have two carriages and you cannot book a seat.
I have recently had to travel through london to get a train to Swansea to book a seat and the dress and cost of doing this is putting me off visiting my son and grandchildren 
You cannot believe this is happening in the uk.

items.title: Useless - SUMS THEM UP
items.review_text: Useless, cancelled multiple trains, tried to get repay and comes up don't recognize ticket number and not todays date, no that,s why I put fridays date in. SHAME THEY DONT RUN A SERVICE OR PROVIDE REFUNDS AS WELL AS THEY MAKE SIGNS AND ANOUNCEMENTS IN WELSH

items.title: Worst train company in the UK.
items.review_text:
Genuinely horrendous train company - logic or timekeeping are, apparently, not words in their vocabulary. As someone who has used a lot of their trains out of pure necessity (and with their precursor company arriva trains wales) I cannot remember an occasion where their trains ran on time, or were not cancelled. Often there is a combination of both issues. Avoid trains operated by this company at all costs, sincerely.

P.s. the only people to have rated this more than 2 stars MUST be employed by the company to leave positive reviews, it is that bad.

items.title: Got on the train at church Stretton 10…
items.review_text:
Got on the train at church Stretton 10 mins late but plenty of time to catch the Aberystwyth train at Shrewsbury. 
Arrived at Shrewsbury train fully on the platform but they did not let us off for 5 minutes until the train I wanted was pulling out of the station. 
Next train 2 hours wait no reason for holding us on the train a number of people wanted the same connection. 
Caught the bus in the end won't be buying multiplex tickets ever again.

items.title: Not worth 1 star apsoulty shambolic…
items.review_text:
Not worth 1 star apsoulty shambolic rude staff delayed and cancelled trains every day.
Trains never on time never have anoth coaches every service is an apsoult joke. From my experience it is the worst railway company I have ever used. The expect you to pay fares that cripple your bank account with shambolic fears disgusting service. Hope they ate all ashamed if not they should be.

items.title: Caught train from port talbot to…
items.review_text: Caught train from port talbot to Manchester only place was standing all way to cwmbran you pay enough and expect a seat and only 2 carriages was the 11.18 on 6th Sept 2022 total disgusting service where I had to stand with having knees complaint people had suit case on seats I want some sort of compensation

items.title: Dreadful Whitchurch to Manchester &…
items.review_text: Dreadful Whitchurch to Manchester & back cancelled again, & at peak time How does this company stay in business. 13 years of these clowns ruining our lives. The Welsh should stop trying to persevere with a nonsense language & road signs & learn to prosper in the real World.

items.title: Absolute joke arrived into Chester on…
items.review_text: Absolute joke arrived into Chester on the 9.27 from Warrington bank quey, should have left Chester at 9.59 yet didn't leave until 10.10 and we moved less than a mile out of the station only to stop again, I have a bus to catch at Shotton which I have now missed due to this hideous train service, VERY POOR  they don't worry about the knock on effect of people have connections weather it be another train or a bus

items.title: At least I am not alone at having to…
items.review_text: At least I am not alone at having to deal with this incompetent rail firm used on 8th Dec never again .if they are going to use excuses then make sure all staff use the same one .the day I travelled 3 excuses you could not make up up.

items.title: Awful service Birmingham New Street to…
items.review_text: Awful service Birmingham New Street to Aberystwyth, train was late as usual. Trains over crowded as usual. Slow service as usual. TFW really need to start to provide a better service. Only reason it didn't get one star is because the train is actually running.

items.title: Unsafe, Absent and on borrowed time.
items.review_text: I have complained directly to TFW and thought I would pop on here to see the general opinion in case I was expecting too much. It appears everyone feels the same however. I couldn't tell you the last time I managed to get a seat on a TFW service, normally standing up for over two hours if needing to get to Manchester. The Manchester service on 3rd December was on a level I have never experienced before. If you are going to cram people into 2 carriages, you need to have staff at stations or on board to monitor the situation and say enough is enough. There always seems to be a collection of TFW trains sat at Chester off main tracks, never used.

items.title: Limited range & incongruous rolling stock
items.review_text:
Limited range, 
Trains go to Manchester but not Bristol which would be so useful. Also lines are often really congested (especially the Marches). The rolling stock feels really cheap at times. The renovations have been quite nice but we still have to use awful trains about 50% of the time… and congested ones about 70% of the time. The cancellations are really awful. I’ve had to wait about an additional 2hrs at New Inn a lot of the time because of cancellations. Has potential but really needs to be made to an excellent standard for everyone.

items.title: Absolutely appalling service between…
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling service between Cardiff and Manchester. 2 carriages, poor facilities, overcrowded and not only unhygienic, but not even cattle travel in such poor conditions. Standing room only on a 3h30 service is just not acceptable.

items.title: How is this company still going
items.review_text: How is this company still going? I think they need new management. Always an issue when I travel and always adds time onto my journey having to hop on different trains. Way over priced for the service. If you are 6ft plus and need to travel longer than an hour look elsewhere or you’ll need a knee replacement after a few journeys 😂

items.title: Worst travelling experience in my life.
items.review_text: 1 star is too high. Travelled from Newport all the way to Manchester Piccadilly standing up. It was disgusting and shambolic. Our original train was cancelled, so we got the next available train an hour later. Train turned up, 2 carriages. It was full even when we got on. Then onto Cwmbran, Abergavenny, Hereford, etc. more were getting on and not many getting off. We had elderly people having to stand in between luggage. Health & Safety was out of the window. We then travelled onto Leeds from Manchester (Transpennine Express) about 1 and a 1/2hrs travelling time. There were seats we could actually sit on. We are really looking forward to the return trip home to Newport tomorrow…..Not.

items.title: Absolute shower of crap
items.review_text: Absolute shower of crap. £280.40 for a return to London and TfW cannot even manage the first train of the day leaving on time. I’ve multiple compensation claims open with them, which they are very slow to pay. Avoid at all costs.  No chance of travelling sustainably when driving is the only reliable option

items.title: Incompetence is a soft statement
items.review_text: For the love of god! I know that you want better pay and a better contract but the way you just do not communicate anything to you customers is just more than shameful! I am now wondering if I got to book a hotel or not and nobody is here to make the situation clear. It’s not your customers that are deciding about your pay, you are just screwing over normal people to get to your upper management. Shame on you! I’ve traveled to many places but I have never seen such a incompetent rail service as here. I’ll advise you to target te people that actually can change something instead of people trying to get home..

items.title: Would give 0 stars if I could company…
items.review_text: Would give 0 stars if I could company is a joke don’t send you your tickets when paid online I screenshot my proof woman at Newport train station was also a joke and wasn’t letting me through won’t ever use this pathetic company again

items.title: Joke of the century
items.review_text:
Seriously given a one star as there’s no option for zero stars. So sick of sitting on the Abergavenny station listening to “ we re sorry but the train is delayed, we apologise for any inconvenience caused” 
Are you though? 
Are you really sorry? 
Every single time……

items.title: TFW is the 💩 that keeps giving
items.review_text:
The train company, which keeps giving 💩 service!!!!.
The 16:20 train to Hereford was once again dangerous to bursting point. Only 2 carriages on. It's basically giving the ground staff water pistols to fight a forest fire. People who needed the toilet were basically holding it in as nowhere to actually move.
Luckily I got off at Hereford where all the students got on and rammed again.

Just got back on the 22:20 train which had no lights in the carriage. I'm 6ft 2, but females in that awful conditions would feel nervous. 

Just when you think this service couldn't get any worse.......it keeps giving new lows. !!!!.

Use your cars, bicycles or even a donkey would be better than this awful show

items.title: Unacceptable
items.review_text: Travelling from Northampton to Llandudno. Great service on spacious modern trains with London NorthWestern as far as Crewe. The platform at Crewe was packed with people and when the two coach, forty year old train arrived late it became obvious why every one was almost pushing people out of the way to get on! They had obviously become accustomed to the overcrowding, minimum number of seats with adequate legroom, lack of ventilation and what can only be described as an unacceptable level of service. Change at Chester and it was even worse! Why is TfW not leasing some of the vastly superior, newer trains coming of lease and going for scrap, instead of using one and two coach, life expired stock? I know TfW is awaiting delivery of new trains, but that is no excuse...especially at these prices!

items.title: Tonypandy to Cardiff never runs
items.review_text: Tonypandy to Cardiff never runs. For over a year now it’s replacement buses and cancelled services, work on the line, “improvements to line”, too windy, no staff, only other option is a 2 hour bus. Someone needs step in and sort TFW out it’s an absolute joke of a service.

items.title: Disgraceful service from start to finish!
items.review_text: Trains cancelled, destinations changed mid journey, misinformation, platform changes left, right and centre, replacement bus service not fit for purpose, subsequent overcrowding of trains, toilets out of service, confusion on what tickets then allowed and where to, to complete journey... Need I say more?! But I will... just a complete disgrace and those in charge should be ashamed of themselves both for the level of service provided to customers and for putting their employees in such horrendously awkward positions of having to make excuses and deal with irate customers. Just an absolute shambles and really shouldn't be allowed to continue. It seems that this is unlikely to be sorted anytime soon. Disgraceful! (And don't bother replying to this post as nothing you can say will justify this situation. Not interested in excuses just action in a positive direction but that remains to be seen!)

items.title: Helpful staff, high standard of customer service
items.review_text: It was the only service running towards Birmingham from Shrewsbury. Understandably it could only go as far as Wolverhampton due to strikes. One of the TfW staff members from the train walked a group of us to the tram station (10 min walk) at Wolverhampton as soon as we stepped off which was highly appreciated. All staff remained in good spirits which made a huge positive difference to the general mood of passengers regardless of the change and disruption to the normal service.

items.title: Awful.
items.review_text: Moved to Wales at the end of 2022 and the worst thing about it is TfW which I have to use for work. Constantly late, cancelled, delayed trains. Constant bus replacements. Constantly dangerously overcrowded. Ridiculously expensive for a service that barely functions.

items.title: If I could do lower than one stars I…
items.review_text: If I could do lower than one stars I would. Always trains delayed or moving platform, unfriendly staff, always cancellations. If it was free fair enough but way too overpriced. They really need to sort it out terrible service.

items.title: Dedicated guards on Cambrian Line. Guards are essential part of passenger care.
items.review_text: The journey was difficult as a result of flooding leading to two bus replacements but it all ran very smoothly and the staff were al friendly and helpful with the various changes.  When I accidentally left my laptop at Tywyn station the guards on the Cambrian line  were exceptionally helpful in retrieving it and went way beyond what might have been expected of them.  Can't thank them enough ....such care for their passengers' welfare and wellbeing.

items.title: Public transportation a joke…
items.review_text: This Welsh labour government pushes the green agenda. You catch a train that takes 45 minutes, (you think) but you end up having to catch a bus and your still on it one hour later with no explanation why you have to catch a bus and not the train. stay in your car everyone

items.title: A chore and an insult to passengers.
items.review_text: Travelling with this company continues to be a chore. There is a complete disconnect between the different branches of IT which should be underpinning the whole operation. The senior IT team, starting with the CTO, should be refunding failed passenger journeys personally. Perhaps then they'd demonstrate some professionalism.

items.title: Horrendous
items.review_text: Horrendous - significantly delayed by more than 1 hour, the delay repay form on their website doesn't have my times and manual entry is broken. Have emailed customer service and provided a lot of evidence but they seem to just ignore their inbox.

items.title: Always late, overcrowded, or cancelled
items.review_text:
You will feel like livestock in a cattle car. 

I'm getting driving lessons soon, so that I never ever use this pathetic company again.

items.title: I got the train from Llandudno junc to…
items.review_text:
I got the train from Llandudno junc to Cardiff at 12.19 .. I went first class as the price difference was reasonable. The service was excellent, the lady who served me cups of tea and lunch was polite and professional. Train arrived on time .. no issues with price, service or the standard of the train. 
Thought some positive feedback maybe welcome

items.title: TOTALLY INCOMPETENT COMPANY!
items.review_text:
TFW are such an incompetent company and should never be allowed to operate. The amount of trains that are regularly cancelled or massively delayed is ridiculous! Not to mention the poor / dangerous state of the trains and complete lack of carriages. Then for the staff working for them to have the cheek to ask for a pay rise 😂😂.

Maybe TFW hierarchy should see how the trains operate in mainland Europe. I visited Brussels a few years back and used trains while there. Very regular service, nearly all trains on time or only 1 or 2 minutes late. Local trains were very fast with 10+ carriages and modern trains. Customer service there was also excellent.

Never in a millions years could TFW operate on a professional level like that!

items.title: Once again a complete an utter…
items.review_text: Once again a complete an utter shambles. Absolutely useless organisation. Trains are always late and/or cancelled and always overcrowded. They’ve had years now to sort this out and nothing is changing.

items.title: VERY disappointed.
items.review_text: VERY disappointed.. had a great trip to Cardiff and my mum was getting her train back to Pembrokeshire. Obviously late train( which seems standard)only 2 carriages.. and driver of train doesn't seem to slow down and stops right on the end of the platform furthest away ( which interestly the platform guard who was speaking to my mum at the time said didn't know why the driver had gone that!) Anyway.. 2 carriages lots of people rushing my mum falls(and hurts herself) due to people rushing( not there fault!) Sort your trains out! Sort the delays/carriage numbers! She is badly bruised and has cuts on her arms/hands.. 😔😔😒 and then what a shock more delays/change of train on the way back! Very disappointing!

items.title: The absolute worst
items.review_text: The absolute worst. For years I have persevered with this train service, because I want to do my bit for the environment, but I have now given up and am going to drive from now on. Nearly every single day there is a cancellation or delay (always, without fail, at the very last minute). Or often only one carriage will turn up and you can’t get on the train due to overcrowding, or you do and you’re packed like cattle. There have been multiple times where I have been left completely stranded and unable to get home from work due to cancellations, and they do not put a bus replacement service on. They push the time back and back and make you run from platform to platform, only at the very last second to announce it’s been cancelled. They are a disgrace and put Wales to shame.

items.title: TFW shambles of a company
items.review_text:
Been travelling from Cardiff to Carmarthen quite a lot during the last few months,what a shambles of a train company i believe its run by welsh government which is no surprise really.
During the evening rush hour there are only two carriages on and the train is absolutely packed out we are like sardines in a tin. Why on earth don't they put on three carriages they know it's rush hour . Everyone is running and pushing each other especially by the younger ones who want a seat no matter what and the older generation just get pushed and shoved around and end up standing and getting crushed by everyone around them. It's only a matter of time before someone gets hurt . On the outward bound from Carmarthen the trains are filthy and every time we get on ther is always some drunks onboard but nobody says anything because they would just get violent. On one occasion the person on the coffee trolley even sold them more alcohol and wished that he could joint them. This has got to be the worse train company about.I have only travelled on Great western railways once and it was heaven . Clean trains ,good staff and no rowdy passengers it was heaven. TFW need to get there act together.

items.title: Don't use....terrible
items.review_text: Crowds of people all with prepaid tickets for the 23:09 train to Hereford it couldn't accommodate all the passengers leaving them stranded. So, they get coaches, to take the stranded passengers to Hereford, obviously the driver was pretty annoyed at being woken up, so he drove like an absolute lunatic, with a coach full of passengers, honking his horn at any driver that was in his way. Also complaining he had to make a 3 hour round trip and then had to be at work for 5 am. Disgusting service, I would never recommend to anyone.

items.title: Yet again another cancellation for…
items.review_text: Yet again another cancellation for Transport for Wales. It is becoming more of the norm these days, resulting in having to account for the possibility with every journey. The following trains are always crammed with passengers due to lack of carriage space, and more than once I've been worried about the ability to load my bike in for a journey. With the amount of money myself and everyone else is paying for this service, it is ridiculous how unreliable this service is. If a train isn't cancelled it's likely delayed. A couple week's ago, we arrived into a station, on our way from Birmingham to Cardiff and were just told the train was ending there, no further explanation and staff knew nothing. I feel bad for the staff getting the flak for these cancellations and delays when it could be resolved by having more trains, more carriages, or better maintenance standards.

items.title: Absolute shambles of an organisation
items.review_text:
Absolute shambles of an organisation. Don't think I've ever had a train on time. If I could have given 0 stars that would have been my option. 
Not worthy of any funding or the money it charges. If you can get anywhere without getting one of their trains - ADVISED!

items.title: The things you can guarantee on a TFW…
items.review_text:
The things you can guarantee on a TFW service.
Only 2 carriages for a main service Swansea to Manchester. The carriage are packed with standing room only with no place for luggage. The carriages are extremely overheated. However the Driver had a great time sounding the the horn every 30 seconds throughout the whole journey.

items.title: Shockingly bad
items.review_text:
The service between Manchester/Swansea (and Tenby) has been mainly using 2 x 150 class carriages for months now, despite TfW declaring this was a short term thing ('for a few days') when the class 175 were withdrawn for safety reasons way back in March. Anyone raising questions on Twitter about when the longer trains will be re-introduced is shutdown with a lecture on health and safety. What a way to run a business- no timescales, no accountability to paying customers! Can't believe that they charge around £100 for people to stand 3 hours on this service. I only travel 20 minutes on it and that's more than enough to ruin my day.

Update - October 2023 - still two carriages since February 2023 (very occasionally 3) and the 175s have all disappeared. The JourneyCheck dispensed with train formation updates a long time ago - it's almost as if they don't want to admit how consistently short formed the trains are :/

items.title: After losing a bag containing some…
items.review_text:
After losing a bag containing some valuable items on a train from Cardiff to Newport, the lost property service they refer to was completely unhelpful and useless in helping to recover a simple bag. It has been nearly a month and they have been unable to offer any help over the phone.

The items in the bag included important medication which came to a great cost to me and there is no way of even asking for compensation. They really need a more efficient, easy-to-access lost property system because at the moment it is hopeless.

items.title: Worst train service ever
items.review_text: This train service is definitely the worst in the country. I don’t think I have ever been on a train that isn’t late or has something wrong with it. People use the trains to go to work and to do important things yet no one will end up using this rubbish company if how bad you are carried on!!!!

items.title: Giving one star feels too generous
items.review_text: Giving one star feels too generous. Horrendously over crowded trains during peak travelling times. Trains never on time ether. Shouldn’t open the doors and allow more passengers on the trains when there are no more seats. I swear if the driver ever has to pull an emergency stop anyone who is standing on one of these trains would not stand a flipping chance. Avoid at all costs if you can

items.title: I am literally standing for 30 min now…
items.review_text: I am literally standing for 30 min now and the train doesn’t move. The train has been stopped for 50min in total due to different reasons. The journey should have taken 40min. But no, its like this. Not we are actually moving back. Shambles. Are we really paying for this???????????? Edit: it was late 1:30h. In a 40min journey. The Welsh gov should stop this. Cambrian Line is decades behind the times. And service appalling. A total joke. Not going to use the trains anymore.

items.title: Overcrowded, hot, loud, late, crap.
items.review_text: 90% of the time Tfw trains are overcrowded (2 carriages) and late. They are hot, loud and the seeting is appropriate only for children. They are always a horrible, expensive experience and avoided wherever possible.

items.title: absolutely zero organisational skills!
items.review_text:
i’d give zero if i could!! where to start, i’ve been using the rail for the last 12 weeks working in the city centre, every morning at 6.30 we get a five carriage service, which is relatively full, yet come 5pm rush hour we get 2 carriages!! cancelled services with absolutely no guidance from staff, relying on other passengers to get the right info as absolutely nothing is available from their staff! To top this off i’ve lost over 5 days wages due to your TFW staff striking, yet another bit of proof that TFW couldn’t organise a drink in a brewery! 

 Conductors shouting at passengers on todays massively over crowded service o make room from the doors, in a condisending tone, yet is it our fault that we are provided with half the normal carriage space.

But low and behold half the train doesn’t equate to half price tickets!! 

I got one will be going back to using my car even if it takes longer, paying £8 for a ticket to stand for 45 minutes doesn’t sit right with me!

items.title: Never known a company like it
items.review_text: The amount of ridiculous delays. Was sat on a train for 15 minutes to just be told it was cancelled after it was already over 30 minutes late. The audacity of this lot to go on strike, bare level of capability wouldn't be too much

items.title: Absolutely terrible train service
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible train service. Cancelled with 10 minutes notice, stopping short of their destination, clueless staff and they are striking for better pay! Try doing your job properly first!!!!!!!!!

items.title: Two carriages from Pyle to Cardiff on…
items.review_text: Two carriages from Pyle to Cardiff on Easter holidays!?! Dangerously overcrowded train. I could have driven but thought I’d support public transport. Never again !

items.title: Currently on a train back from…
items.review_text: Currently on a train back from Manchester to Cardiff. The trains just don’t seem fit for purpose in terms of comfort for the length of journey and number of passengers. It is extremely cramped and the train is old and not particularly clean. For a £70 return (with railcard), it just seems very bad value for money.

items.title: Cancelling trains with little warning…
items.review_text: Cancelling trains with little warning and not being at all reliable for someone needing to get to work even just one stop away.

items.title: Absolute bunch of no loosers running a…
items.review_text: Absolute bunch of no loosers running a quango in wales, trains always late and overcrowded wag are a bunch to##ers waiting for train again which app says it's left, but no sign of service,  shame on you wag, you should fall on a sword and do us all a favour

items.title: Bigest joke of a rail company in the…
items.review_text:
Bigest joke of a rail company in the history of the railway. In fact you can't call it a train company as the trains are always late and normally over packed. Try and sort out transport for a bike but get no help. 
How a firm like this is allowed to operate is beyond belief.

items.title: Zero stars.
items.review_text: Picked up Camarthen train at Crewe. Two carraige train already full. Had to stand. packed in like sardines. Suitcases blocking the aisles. Absolutely dangerous. Will never use this company again.

items.title: This shower of cretins couldn’t run a bath!
items.review_text:
This shower of cretins couldn’t run a bath!

Taken over from Arriva Trains Wales with all the promises under the sun and can’t even provide a service from Birmingham to Telford because of shortages of crews. Leaving me and 5 friends in the lurch late one evening

Why bother? Just give up now you bunch of bellends!

items.title: Disgusting Service
items.review_text:
Disgusting. 2 Carriages FULL to the brim. Since when did I turn into a sardine? Whoever "Owen" is on all these responses with his boring monotonous responses, he should change the record. These cleansed corporate messages are pathetic. 
If TFW was not run by the Welsh tax payers i.e. the Welsh Government, it would be bankrupt on day one.  How the hell can they afford to run such a ridiculously low quality service? How can they afford ALL these refunds?
I bet my bottom dollar that this Metro system down south takes ALL the revenue from the north Wales coastline. 2 carriages, so decrepit that it makes me ashamed to be Welsh. Amd with 'Owen's' promise of new trains.....I BET THERE WILL STILL ONLY BE TWO CARRIAGES ON THE COAST. Avanti for me!

items.title: Absolutely awful
items.review_text:
Absolutely awful.  I travelled to Warrington from Bangor on Monday and my Granddaughters are doing the same trip home now.  On both occasions only 2 carriages are available as usual.  When they know this line is busy, Holyhead to Manchester etc, WHY only 2 carriages.  We have one line so obviously the trains are going to be busy.  On another occasion my Granddaughter and I were pressed against the door, scary to say the least.
Absolutely shoddy with no care for the travellers whatsoever.
I just read ‘Owens’ responses below.  How long will the excuse about 2 carriages carry on????  I use the train a lot but am fed up now so will be booking via other company.
Editing this to add that my 2 Granddaughters were travelling on the so called direct train to Bangor from Warrington and again 2 carriages.  2 young girls had to sit on the floor by the doors.
TFW ….  We don’t need excuses just action.  absolute joke.

items.title: Went away to Llandudno for 5 days
items.review_text: Went away to Llandudno for 5 days. Set off from Manchester Piccadilly, only two carriages,  train was full all the way to Llandudno, and the same on the return journey. Disappointing. Don't understand why only two carriages.

items.title: I’ve spent my life using trains up and…
items.review_text: I’ve spent my life using trains up and down the country and TFW is hands down the absolute worst service. You might as well ignore the timetable as they rarely stick to it. 2 carriages when the train actually shows up and constantly striking. If I could give zero stars I would. Utter joke of a company

items.title: Standing Room Only
items.review_text: Gave one star as I couldn't give zero. What a consistently appalling service. They should not be charging anyone for a seat as the odds of getting one are about one in three. How can they have just two carriages on the Cardiff to Manchester line? If you have an alternative form of transport then I suggest you take it.

items.title: 2 Carriages Only?
items.review_text: I have used TFW from Crewe to Manchester on various occasions recently. Whilst the trains have been on time, they are frequently over crowded to the point where it appears to be dangerous. Why only two carriages for such a busy service?

items.title: If I could rate this 0 I absolutely…
items.review_text:
If I could rate this 0 I absolutely would!! Shocking service. Our train was delayed on the journey out and then completely cancelled on the way back. We were provided a replacement taxi (fair enough), however had to wait an hour and 30 minutes for this in the cold and darkness outside of the station! No access to any toilet and then all the staff left and the station closed and we were left waiting in the dark on our own.

I have since been back and forth with customer services to obtain a refund for my journey considering the shocking state of the train service and not actually get the train back, only to be told they don’t have records of the train being cancelled!! As if I am lying about the whole situation. 

Extremely frustrating that I have wasted so much time on this and had such a poor customer service. 

AVOID

items.title: From bad to worse
items.review_text:
For several years now, TfW's Owen and Holly have been assuring people on here that once their new trains are up and running, overcrowding will be a thing of the past.  However as of October 2023, the curse of 2 carriages continues on most routes, and there were more scenes of chaos at Chester today. Does anyone really believe some new carriages are going to fix this mess?

Clearly the TfW leadership do not know how to run a railway.  There is no resilience, innovation, forward thinking, and everything this organisation does seems perfectly orchestrated to make life as awful as possible for their customers. That they can demand eighty pounds for a return ticket from Chester to Cardiff and expect people to stand all the way is just rubbing salt in the wounds. Cancellations and closures of whole lines are now routine - it seems that TfW feel inconvenienced by running trains when they can simply cancel them instead. Where is the accountability for this shambles? 

Amazingly, sidings at Chester, Wrexham, Holyhead and also Telford have numerous TfW trains sitting doing nothing. Does anyone feel like getting these into service or is that too much?

I didn't think anything could be worse than the days of Arriva Trains Wales, but nationalisation of the network in Wales has been the total disaster that many predicted.

items.title: You really couldn’t write what we went…
items.review_text: You really couldn’t write what we went through as a family on 14 July 2023. We decided to take a short break to Tenby as a family. My husband, me, daughter partner, 3 children son partner 3 children. I have severe arthritis and am partially disabled. We boarded the train for Carmarthen at Cardiff Central no seats standing only. Minutes later told to disembark, no conductor. Everyone told to go to platform 2 for a train, then, we were told to get back on previous train!!! We set off for Carmarthen all cooped up and uncomfortable. Stopped at Swansea, a suitcase fell off the train THEN a very elderly lady fell OFF the train onto another lady, both left lying on the platform! Train driver stopped got out conductor checking train door first aid wheelchair got for lady paperwork exchanged. Then train set off again. Meanwhile autistic grandchild became hysterical. Got to Carmarthen half hour late, Tenby train driver wouldn’t wait and pulled out. Station Manager tried to get coaches all are out on school runs!! So another hour and a half wait for a train to Tenby. No facilities vending machines tea coffee at Carmarthen. Finally, the Station Manager found us a coach. It was so horrendous we decided to forgo our return train tickets on 21 and travel with NATIONAL EXPRESS which are brilliant. Never again will I travel TFW!!!! Zero Stars!!!

items.title: The absolute state of the transport…
items.review_text:
The absolute state of the transport system in the uk. T for wales is worse than northern rail would you believe it. Had to change in Newport as no direct trains from Bristol to Manchester (ridiculous). I audibly gasped as the train pulled up to the station - only two carriages, a tin can looking like a relic of the 1900s for a three hour journey. Was hoping to work on the train but so packed had to sit with travel bags on lap the whole way. Bless the staff working in such an abysmal outdated system - who can blame them for striking. The amount of god awful train experiences I’ve had trying to get between two major cities on this tiny island. Debating buying a car, just to add to the congestion and climate crisis. It’s nearly 2024, where’s tax payer money going?? Certainly not public services. HS2 north now in the pan as well. Rishi and the tories OUT.  

*Edit: Spoke too soon, signalling issue meant train had to be delayed at Abergavenny station for 20/30 mins. At least they let people off to be frustrated in the sun.

**Edit: They cancelled the train at Wilmslow and everyone had to get off and get a connect to Manchester. Abysmal.

items.title: I cannot believe that this kind of…
items.review_text:
I cannot believe that this kind of service is allowed in Britain in this day and age.Awful doesn’t begin to describe it.
Totally shocking.We travelled on Monday15th August from Manchester Oxford Road to Llandudno.We are 78 and 80 years.My partner is disabled and has Parkinson’s.
Neither of us got a seat until we reached Rhyl.Six people were travelling in the toilets!!!There were passengers with babies in pushchairs and someone in a wheelchair.A couple got on with their dog.Absolute chaos…..two carriages were eventually put on in Chester.Why in Chester?Why not at the start of the journey in Manchester?
The return journey a week later was no better although we did get a seat as we got on in Llandudno.Those poor souls who had to fight to get on further down the line on to two carriages were less fortunate.
Two carriages from Llandudno to Manchester Piccadilly!! No additions this journey.Carriages must have originated from the 60’s ??
Dreadful, dreadful dangerous service.Needs sorting urgently.

items.title: Shoddy service, awful customer service
items.review_text: I was due to travel on 31st July but my train was cancelled, I had to get the next one 2hrs later, I was travelling with 3 young children and it was so crowded! I expected it to be busy being school holidays but this was mad, the kids were so hot and our journey was over 3hrs long so we were very grateful to get off at our destination (Talybont) but almost missed our check in time due to the train cancellation forcing us to get the next. I thought I could just put in a claim and it would be ok.......nope! They instantly rejected my claim as my train was not run by them but London Northwestern.....funny that! The train had TfW on the side, all staff had TfW uniforms and I was travelling into Wales so all announcements were in Welsh as well as English. I appealed the decision as they indeed were the train operator but never had a reply and the 10days passed so I'll probably get nothing back. Shame to put only 2 stars as I find the staff so helpful and polite but the service on the trains and the claim system is shocking 😔

items.title: Awful experience from this Wednesday to…
items.review_text: Awful experience from this Wednesday to today. First off we had our train from Cardiff to Manchester delayed at Hereford for almost an hour and a half. Next, when the train departed from Hereford we had an announcement saying that the train was terminating at Crewe with no announcement prior. On the way back from Manchester Piccadilly we had our train to Cardiff Central cancelled due to a 'signal issue' so we had to get a train from Piccadilly to Crewe, to then get off at Crewe. Then we had the train from Crewe to Cardiff (no problems) we got into Cardiff, and we were going to get the 19:11 train from Cardiff to Abercynon (this train was cancelled) now we're waiting for the 19:43 train to Abercynon from Cardiff which had now been delayed (by how long we don't know). At this point I've had enough of Transport for Wales and I think I speak for everyone by saying Transport for Wales, is absolutely shocking and if I could swear on this review, trust me I would.

items.title: Incompetent and chaotic organisation
items.review_text:
Incompetent organisation. Travelled recently from Manchester to Leominster. Trains seriously overcrowded. No seat reservations (current company policy). No refreshment trolley or access to toilets due to passengers standing and sitting in aisle and lobby areas. Guard notable by their absence. Recommend driving (if possible) until franchise is awarded elsewhere.

Update19th January 2023: I wrote to the Chairman of TfW on 31/10/22 to complain about my awful journey. Finally received a response on 17/1/23. Rather demonstrates the contempt of this company towards their fare paying customers. I was simply pointed towards the 'capacity checker' for future journeys. So, rather than tackle the real problem, TfW simply sets up a website! Next franchise operator please.

I also requested (under The Freedom of Information Act) the number of times that TfW trains guards have prevented passengers boarding trains because of overcrowding. The response - '...typically we do not deny boarding a service given there is no legal capacity cap on trains. If a customer is happy to board a service we would not look to deny them access....'

So, board a TfW train at your own risk....

items.title: Consistently Terrible
items.review_text:
I travel between Edinburgh and Shrewsbusbury 2-3 times a month. 
My first train is usually great however as soon as I get to Crewe I’m travelling with TFW and I utterly dread this part of the journey now. 
A few weeks ago I was travelling alone in the evening, they cancelled my train and but told us they would be getting taxis, then changed their minds (communicated it badly I was told by other passengers) and sent us on a wild goose chase on an alternative route. 
It was after midnight, I was alone, freezing and I struggled to get a taxi when I eventually arrived in Shrewsbury. 

That’s just one example, I have many, many more I could share. They cancel trains too often but I also dread getting on them when they are running because they put on just 2 carriages between Crewe and Shrews, so it is always jam packed, very hard to get a seat and uncomfortably hot! 
The seats and tables are so tiny, they seem to be built for elves or goblins rather than humans! 

I’ve travelled by train a lot over the past 20 years and I can say without a doubt that TFW is the worst train ‘service’ I have ever experienced. 
I utterly despise travelling with them. 
It beggars belief that these incompetent fools manage such an important service. These trains are vital for people living in the areas they are meant to ‘service’ 
The only thing you can rely on them for is to be consistently terrible! 
I literally hate this company!

items.title: I don’t know where to start with this…
items.review_text:
I don’t know where to start with this absolute shambles of a train operator.
I live in Shrewsbury and regularly commute up to Manchester Piccadilly on route to Burnley.
The trains are the old Arriva ones just painted red and refurbed slightly inside the carriages.
Peak times on Saturdays only two carriage trains are used meaning having to stand for all or part of the journey. 
I was on a course in Liverpool a couple of months ago so had to catch the first train out of Shrewsbury in the morning up to Crewe for the connection to Chester. Guess what, even the first train out was 12 minutes late. Missed connection.
I have travelled midweek journeys to Manchester and because trains have been running so late have been dumped off at Wilmslow because they were terminating the service.
Most recent journey was Sunday 10th December from Wilmslow to Shrewsbury after coming from Manchester Airport. Train was 18 minutes late on arrival and dangerously overcrowded. Usual 2 carriages. Excuse given this time was that it was late because of a high volume of trains in for repair?? You couldn’t script it.
Usual one is staff shortages. Many working people would give their high teeth to work on the railways especially on TFW as they are higher paid than other rail employees because they are paid by Welsh Government. However, you need to be related or know someone to get anywhere near a job with them.
I have had dozens of lousy experiences travelling with this absolute shambles of a train company.
I remember when they took over from Arriva and announced that they would improve services in Wales and England. What a joke. Arriva weren’t the best but compared to these they were outstanding.
They need stripping of the franchise. TFW is not fit for purpose.
NB Just had a response from TFW saying due to recent storms trains are in for repair hence affected services and cancelled trains.
Whilst I accept the current situation they have been cancelling trains regularly for the last two years and have not put appropriate number of carriages on busy routes at peak times.
When catching trains in Shrewsbury now towards West Midlands I prefer to pay a little bit extra to travel with West Midlands Trains as opposed to TFW cattle wagons.

items.title: Awful
