items.title: Appalled by this morning’s incident
items.review_text:
As I departed the train, I was shocked to see at least 10 (maybe more) TfW staff at this usually unmanned station. We were asked to show our tickets. Although I offered to pay for a ticket, I was horrified to be asked to fill in a form instead, giving them my name, address, date of birth etc, as well as them taking a photo of my ID. This is because it is apparently an offence to travel without a ticket, even if you’re willing to pay. Bizarre, as manned stations in the past have allowed me to buy a ticket after getting off the train, before letting me through the barriers, and I have been allowed to buy tickets from the conductor on the train since I began taking the train, well over a decade ago. Seems like very mixed messages to me. I was given a notice, telling me to pay for the price of a single ticket, apparently with 21 days to pay. My question is: wouldn’t it have been easier to just let me buy a ticket there and then, as I was more than happy to do, rather than them choosing to potentially wait up to 3 weeks? Overall, instead of paying £7.80 for a return, I had to pay £12.80 for effectively 2 singles.

I’d also like to complain about the man who said “What’s your excuse, mate”, in a rather condescending tone. I told him that I usually buy a ticket off the conductor (who didn’t check), to which he didn’t respond, walking off instead. I felt like a naughty schoolboy who hadn’t done his homework. Disgusting bully tactics.

items.title: Paid for 1st Class - Got worse than 3rd
items.review_text:
Update on my earlier experience:  After the lack of response from Transport for Wales, I took the case to the Rail Ombudsman.  The result, once they got involved, was a full refund of all fares paid + £40 in travel vouchers.  I would recommend anyone else who has been subjected to the dreadful service offered by this company to do the exact same thing.  

1st Class tickets were purchased on 29th November 2022 for journeys between Chester and Bath Spa via Newport on the 6th February and from Bath Spa to Chester on the 8th February.  On the 6th February our train was supposed to be a loco hauled set of coaches including a first class carriage.  What turned up was a 3 coach unit with no 1st class.  This broke down somewhere between Craven Arms and Ludlow where a man had to be sent out to it in a taxi to fix it.  We arrived at Newport 2 hours late and so missed our onward connection.  The only alternative at Newport was another unit with no 1st class.  The return journey on the 8th February was considerably worse.  At Newport I checked with station staff that the train would include 1st class and offer dinner. I was assured that it would.  We were looking forward to our dinner in 1st class accommodation.  What turned up 30 minutes late was a 2-car unit.  It was filthy and noisy.  There was no heat, no wifi, no first class, no room.  It staggered as far as Chester and then was taken out of service.  I have tried to claim my money back but got no response from Transport for Wales.  The guard on the 8th, who was unable to fix the lack of heat in the unit, said the management of Transport for Wales are a total shambles.  I would have to say that I agree with him.  And add that they took my money under false pretenses.

items.title: The wonders of Rail travel in Wales.
items.review_text:
The wonders of Rail travel in Wales.
Reason for travel, to visit my brother.
Using rail travel to complete the journey from Cardiff to Wrexham return. Was travelling on the 9:22 from Cardiff Central to Wrexham General,  This left at 10:10, due to issues with the new train and the Canton Depot. the departure platform was changed 4 times before leaving the station. This was the Holyhead train, but was now stopping at Bangor because of fault with the train. Finally arrived at 12:35 in Wrexham.

I was also booked on the return journey at 18:37, luckily at 16:50 I noticed that this train was cancelled (was this the same train as the morning?), I had picked this train as it was a direct train.

As the next train was an hour later with a change at Shrewsbury, I could not trust this being late/cancelled as I would have missed  the last train to Caerphilly.

I was able to get to Wrexham Station to check for alternatives and the staff were polite and friendly. I was advised that my ticket would be valid on the earlier train, so I caught the 17:45 to Birmingham International and then swap to the Manchester - Cardiff train at Shrewsbury.

On this train the conductor checked my ticket and said my ticket was invalid on this train, but because my train had been cancelled he would allow it, as if it was my fault. No seat on this train as it was busy and 15 minutes late arriving. When we got to Shrewsbury everyone was told to get off the train as it was faulty. They had to get on a replacement train, while I waited for the Cardiff bound train, on a cold windy platform with no chance of a hot drink, as both the Wrexham and Shrewsbury Cafes has closed. The train arrived and I was able to get a seat, on a very cold train for the 2 and a half hour journey to Cardiff, no refreshment trolley (there had been one on the way up).

The final leg of the journey was from Cardiff to Aber/Caerphilly, but it was a bus replacement service because of line issues they had after maintenance. So my journey continued via the Merthyr Train to Taffs Well, where I managed to get a lift home by car. 

This did highlight the issues of TFW, and the Welsh Government plans for all Wales transport links, As I travelled to Taffs Well I saw the TFW Transport Hub that is being built there at incredible cost and you cannot get a handful of trains to run successfully to North Wales, but South Wales will have nice shiny rolling stock and stations. Luckily I live in South Wales. Next time I will drive!

items.review_text: Absolute joke waited for a train from ten to 6 one got cancelled then waited for another at 6.40 then got told that it was the wrong train then I gets an attitude off the train workers when I explain what a sham they are and saying that they clearly don't deserve to be on 90 grand a year just by standing around not helping people say what platform the actual trains on then waits for the 5 to 7 with 50 people trying to get on 2 carriages with the people running on the rain like its bedlam then sitting on the train with teenage drunks pushing past with no respect for us older folk let's say I won't be traveling to Cardiff again as I literally had to stand up for 45 minutes you never get this problem in England as they have more carriages and people fighting tooth and nail for seats let's say TPFW is an absolute rip off who don't care about the public just happy to laugh in your face and take your money without a care in the world

items.title: TFW The worst main line Railway Service in The UK
items.review_text:
This company is the pits when it comes to its main line services I.E South Wales to Manchester Piccadilly services Passenger 1A services , I use the Crewe to Cardiff services 2-3 times a week whilst travelling from Glasgow to Cardiff Central and you can almost Guarantee whilst waiting for the TFW train to come into Crewe station (station changing point towards Cardiff Central) around peak times 16.30-18.30 the company uses a 2 Car Class 150 units for the over 200 mile journey at reduced speeds as the 150 units are usually seen on the valley/Local South wales lines , The train is always Packed & overcrowded as they have not got the capacity to
Fit in the people, Class 150 Old 2 car units with uncomfortable seats for the long journey
On A1 passenger services, Very rarely on board the train are there any facilities for even for the lightest refreshment Tea/Coffee, All I hear from TFW we have new trains lots of them but unfortunately the company are still using these awful Class 150 & even 2x Class 153 units coupled up together on this long distance service, At present the companys Class 197,231 & 756 flirt trains are only deployed on local & minor routes and were now almost at the end of May 2023. Most of TFW new class 197 trains are stored at various places around the UK including Crewe which has 10-12 complete units in storage , Why don’t they start training drivers to use these new trains on there main line services instead of making us all suffer with 40 Year old units which are now at the end off there life & definitely had there day . In my my estimation it is the UK worst rail service at the present time and someone in TFW needs their rear end kicked & needs to start thinking about their paying customers either that or change there name to ‘The Pits rail services’ Appalling

items.title: Chronic overcrowding and overpriced
items.review_text:
You can rest assured that on the busiest day of the year, TfW will put out the smallest trains in their fleet and expect people to cram themselves in and stand like that for hours until they reach their destination - little different from those Victorian cattle trains.  

I was recently at Birmingham New Street and the 15:25 to Holyhead showed up and it was a tiny two coach class 150, a class of train that is absolutely inadequate on busy routes like that one. 150s were only intended for use on quieter branch lines so why TfW think they can get away with forcing paying customers to tolerate this is anyone's guess. There were crowds of people waiting for this train at New Street and a good number of them were not able to board.

They did the same thing for the rugby in Cardiff earlier this year when people were forced to stand shoulder to shoulder in a 150 all the way from Anglesey. Charging people for that third world service is disgusting.  There are trains available for hire for these special events, especially when you have as much advanced warning of a major sporting event, but of course TfW have no interest in doing that because they do not give a hoot about their passengers. You have to wonder why these people chose a career in the rail industry.

And then come their arrogant press releases after people complain about overcrowding where they take no responsibility whatsoever and never explain why their trains are so small.

items.title: Fabulous lost and found service
items.review_text:
Normally reviews are uploaded only in the event of uncomfortable experiences. Time to change that.
I undertook a very short journey from Chester to Bangor this morning. And maybe because I was still half asleep early on Sunday morning, I ended up leaving my backpack on the train as I alighted. Obviously very focused on getting the suitcase!

Realization dawned a few minutes later as the train breezed past the platform.
Upon enquiry I was immediately directed to Platform 1 where a friendly bloke took my details and immediately rang up the final destination of the train. Within half hr, I had telephonic confirmation that my bag  had been picked up. And in less than 90 minutes after that, it was back where it must belong!
The affable dude was named Reece. If that's the way he treats all his customers, his employer may want to offer him a bonus! Misadventure averted, let the adventures in Wales begin!!

items.title: What a joke of a service
items.review_text:
What a joke of a service. I'm wondering if either Owen or Meg will be brave enough to come back to me with a human response rather than with the trite copy and paste, stock standard response, as they seem to have done to all the other complaints from other rightly shocked and disgusted customers of TFW...?

I really do pity both of these poor s ods having to make their mealy mouthed apologies on behalf of quite possibly the worst run rail franchise in Britain. Which by default means the worst in Europe.

 Of course,it has to be the Welsh franchise that suffers that ignominious title...THE WORST RAIL FRANCHISE IN BRITAIN. 

Following on from that other complete clusterf uck train company Arriva Trains Wales. 

When we landed with this useless company we were assured that they would be better than that other useless lot - Arriva. TFW spent many millions of pounds assuring us of that.

How anyone could rival those incompetents for a complete lack of efficiency, travel service and customer is mind blowing. But they surpass them in their shoddy, unprofessional and disgraceful service with flying colours.

Telling people that they could use the next available service when a service is cancelled with minutes notice or even none at all is a sick joke - especially late at night when there is no 'later service'. 

Telling people that they do not take these decisions lightly when it is a continual occurrence is also complete garbage. It's precisely because it is so easy to do that you do it. If you were fined heavily for doing so, you wouldn't do it. Simples.

I could go on but I have better things to do with my time. Take a really long look at yourselves TFW....NO, A REALLY, REALLY, LONG LOOK AT YOURSELVES.  
Look at your Trust Pilot score out of 5...and consider that we HAVE TO GIVE YOU A MINIMUM SCORE OF 1 BECAUSE IT WONT LET US GO ANY LOWER. 

Your score currently is 1.3 out of 5 currently. You can't even raise your score to be a full point above a completely bloody useless company - don't bother to try and use us - best off crawling on your knees over broken glass to get to your destination. I'd love to see that as your next slogan on your marketing.  Because it's the truth.

That's how bad you are. 

(Take it away Meg or Owen) The floor is yours.....

Last winter I took a train from Cardiff to Manchester that had no heating. It was night time and around minus 4 outside. I could see people's breath on the train.

items.review_text:
This is my second review here, and this isn’t even a review, I honestly just want them to be hated so much that they get taken over.
Train to Crewe (I was going to shotton) was supposed to be at 21:48, with no surprise it gets cancelled at 21:30, apparently due to a fault on the train. Wasn’t too bothered as I fully expect the train to be cancelled or at least delayed by this point, but 20 minutes later at exactly 21:51, I see a train coming towards the platform, the train goes by at full speed, and what do I see? “Crewe” was signed on the train, so was it really a fault or was it it just TFW being irresponsible again? I’m sick to death of this company and something needs to be done, so many people rely on public transport for many different reasons, and it’s such a disgrace when almost every single train is significantly delayed or cancelled, especially when a ticket costs twice the amount in comparison to driving, once again, TFW you’re horrendous and should be ashamed of your pitiful company.

Nothing has changed- TfW are still refusing to issue seat reservations, meaning I have another four hours of standing next to someone's armpit to look forward to.

A farce.

items.title: Short-notice train cancellation, stranded in the middle of the night with no help
items.review_text:
Last train from Wrexham to Chester cancelled at short notice, no rail replacement, no one to speak to at the station, no call centre to be reached, message on website unanswered - even today, one month on.  Had to call a taxi myself - 2-hour wait in Wrexham in the middle of winter.

Still waiting for refund and delay compensation - more than a month now. 

TfW have made the conscious choice not to man a call centre in the evening when stranded passengers most need it, and they are failing their own response times for complaints.  In the meantime I'm left out of pocket.

This is even with the significantly reduced passenger volume while the Covid situation continues - this will only get worse once more people start using the trains again. 

Complaint reference is TfWRS-20211211-ABB raised 11 December 2021, still unresolved today 6 Feb 2022.  I haven't even got the money I was forced to spend on a taxi, nor the delay compensation I'm legally entitiled to, not to mention anything to acknowledge the distress and danger caused to me. 


*** Update 4 Feb ***

Still no response, nor compensation from TfW.  The company has chosen to leave me no option but to take this complaint to the ombudsman, causing further unnecessary work, time lost and upset to me.  It is now nearly two months since I made this complaint. TfW are clearly simply hoping that customers give up seeking to recover the costs TfW's conscious and deliberate decisions to run a substandard service have caused them.

Update 23 February.

Still no response from TfW, let alone the compensation I'm due as a statutory right, not to think of an attempt to address the damage and cost they've caused me. 

Chasing a response on their Facebook page yielded the advice from Owen that their system "didn't pick up the e-mail I'd sent in response" to their request to re-supply the tickets (which I'd already sent in with my initial contact) and that the case handler would be asked to look at this.  But this was three days ago, I have received - nothing, no response, no acknowlegement, no status update, nothing.

Update 8 March

Almost a quarter of a year after the initial complaint, still no resolution, not a penny in statutory compensation for the delays, not a penny in compensation for the outlay for the taxi - a clear violation of TfW's contractual duties.  An e-mail to the CEO James Price from 1 March only yielded a response after chasing - the response fails to even correctly summarise the content of the complaint, and needless to say, hasn't led to a resolution or TfW complying with their legal duty to compensate me either.

Update 9 March

I have today received, in the post, a letter dated 7 March.  This contains: the promise to refund the taxi costs and to pay the compensation for the delay I am legally entitled to.  This money hasn't been paid into my bank account yet.  The letter also contains a £10 voucher - a piece of paper that costs TfW nothing.  This is what TfW think of their passengers.  The letter contains no information about any lessons learnt or improvements made as a result.  Initially TfW had informed me that no replacement bus service had been sourced ("Looking at the notes from our Control Team, replacement transport was attempted to be sourced however due to a lack of availability we were unable to provide any."), but in the letter now the same TfW representative claims that a replacement service was organised - failing to comment that I was sent away from the station by a builder working for TfW, as the company had taken the conscious decision not to have any staff present themselves, and also made the conscious choice to make themselves unavailable via telephone or their website.

*** Update 18 March ***

I notice that Owen from TfW has made the conscious choice to comment on reviews submitted later than this, and to say nothing about the utter contempt with which TfW has treated me and my complaint.  I notice that he advises passengers that TfW "will organise taxis", knowing full well that this is not what TfW have done in my case, and knowing full well that TfW have told me there was nothing wrong with their conscious choice not to assist passengers stuck in Wrexham at night like in my case.

items.title: If I could rate them a minus score I…
items.review_text: If I could rate them a minus score I would. Never enough space on the trains...I'm standing in between carriages as I write this (Mcr to Crewe). Absolute rip off.

items.title: Not a reliable service trains cancelled…
items.review_text: Not a reliable service trains cancelled at peak commuter times with no way of getting in or home

items.title: New name, same shambolic service
items.review_text:
You cannot manage the valley lines correctly and yet you think you can manage the metro service??
When I filed a complaint about antisocial behaviour in May, all I received was justification as to why your guard didn't intervene and that I should be contacting the British Transport Police myself, ok so why have a guard then? 
You constantly cancel trains and or put trains on at peak times with only two carriages which is of course, very helpful in not spreading Covid(!)
I thought Arriva were terrible and when TFW took over things would improve but they haven't, there is a huge push to get people driving less and to use public transport more but quite frankly if this is the normal service we are being given at the best of times I'd rather put fuel in my car and drive.
Bitterly dissapointed and let down!

items.title: Poor service

items.title: Honestly, c'mon now

Its bloody freezing and still expected to pay full price for a ticket even after being left waiting half hour in the cold, I haven't been on time for my volenteering job a single day and I'm paying my train fare out of my own pocket, disgusted, absolutely disgusted...

items.title: I feel sorry for myself and the poor…

So now I am stuck with an unusable ticket and TFW have stolen my money .

items.title: Bad.  Real bad.
items.review_text: Hadn't used the train in 2 years because of covid 19 and was unaware of these clowns removing the convenience of buying a ticket from the conductor.  Train is usually late and delayed so when I got there late myself I thought I'd have time to purchase a ticket before boarding but this time the train was waiting so I boarded it thinking I could wait for the conductor.  4 stops and no conductor came so when I left the train I went in search of the ticket office to tell them as I needed a return ticket to fix the situation and didn't want to board the home train looking over my shoulder.  I was approached instead by a outside conductor who gave me a notice worded as if I was a ticket dodger and criminal.  Had to pay a single ticket to get home and a single ticket notice when I got home so couldn't save money on a return.  Expensive for a journey to the hospital.

Trains either late no show or early  you can't run a service like a shambles it's unfair to customers.

items.title: I wouldn't recommend transport for…

But 'John' was far too busy apparently and doesn't care about his oap passengers any more than the rest of them!!!

Don't bother booking and expecting a seat as 'John' informed us today that buying a ticket doesn't mean you get to sit down on tfw trains!!!

Absolute joke of a company and 'John' seemed almost proud of the disgraceful service he presides over!!

Don't book with them!!!
Take the car, take a plane, build yourself a go-kart to go to Wales if you so desire.
But whatever you do, don't book with tfw trains!!!!!

items.title: …Breathtaking!!
items.review_text: If only there was the facility to leave Zero stars!! Only in the U.K would this absolute shambles be allowed to operate. Almost constant delays, cancellations are frequent. It is very rare that there are enough carriages/seats to accommodate travellers. I feel sorry for the staff, who must have to do some serious soul-searching before every shift. Please only use as a last resort, and don't expect the experience to be pleasant.

items.title: Regular delays and disruptions between…
items.review_text: Regular delays and disruptions between Aberystwyth and Birmingham New Street, constant issues. It makes using public transport painful.

items.title: Absolute ordeal...we expect compo...
items.review_text:
Me and my mum were absolutely furious yesterday as we were getting the train back from Conwy to Chester, our plan being to get another train back from Chester to Liverpool, which left 15 minutes after we arrived at Chester station. However, our first train back from Conwy ended up being delayed by 10 minutes, which was made all the more infuriating as they kept reducing the delay on the board so it was only 5 minutes late, only for it to go back to being 10 minutes late again when it actually arrived, having unfairly given us false hope. This meant we were now more rushed for our transfer train from Chester to Liverpool, having been on a knife-edge for the entire journey from Conwy to Chester wondering if we'd make it or not, which was very stressful for us, having had someone meeting us at our originally intended destination as well. This was not helped either as a fight suddenly occured at one of the stations the train stopped off at, with there seeming to be nobody on guard at that station to intervene, meaning the guards on our train had to get off an intervene, only adding to the delay of course. 

To add to things of course, as if we hadn't been fated enough, despite having actually intervened in the fight on the platform, they still actually allowed at least one of the people who were connected with the fight onto the train, who was shouting and swearing away through the window as soon as she got on the train, something which should not have been allowed on a train. We moved into the next carriage of course, as this was especially hard for me being a highly sensitive person.

Of course, we ended up missing the transfer train back from Chester to Liverpool, which was most stressful and infuriating for us. The guard on the train also told us via announcement just as the train was arriving at Chester how to get this train despite the fact we were obviously far too late for it, which they surely must've knewn, but clearly just weren't taking proper note of things. The guard also giving us lost hope by telling us that it looked like the train was making up for lost time and that we'd arrive at Chester at the original time did not help either, as of course we ended up just losing time instead, being even later than we expected.

Our bad luck seemed to not end and our fury only grew as of course now we had missed the train we had originally planned on getting we had to wait another 28 minutes to get the next train that was our inevitable plan b of course, which would be a longer journey than the one we were originally meant to do. As if this wasn't bad enough, I had to pay £7.80 for a new train ticket, something I was not supposed to pay for in the first place, with things only continuing to get worse when I discovered that I couldn't even get it as an e-ticket and had to trek all the way up the stairs, across the bridge and down the stairs to the front of Chester station where the ticket machines where to get my ticket, and back again. This was late at night as well which of course really added to the stress for us, having gotten back home much later than planned.

If this trainline had just not been delayed and messed us around so terribly then things would have gone much smoother for us. This line really needs to get their act together, as such an inconvenience as this has infuriated me and my mum so much that we will not be able to rest mentally until we get the compensation we most require. 

Very appalled at having been messed around so terribly, with such incompetency from this trainline and its connected train services.

items.title: Dangerous Rail Service . Beware.
items.review_text:
I paid for a seat on their Chester to Bangor line. The train arrived over 20 minutes late. Train was completely overbooked and many passengers were forced to stand, including myself, as well as mother's of infants with prams and elderly passengers.  There simply was no place to sit and barely place to stand. (See my profile photo of folks queuing to board). Luggage packed the entry ways and isles.  They brought in a couple more coaches, and, after about another 20 min delay, we finally set off, albeit still standing and packed in like sardines, all while in the midst of a pandemic. If there had been an accident on the line, and a need to disembark quickly, it would've been impossible to do so. This was dangerous on both these fronts. I wrote a DM on Twitter expressing these concerns and was reassured their staff are "properly trained" in safety. Obviously, they are NOT. You cannot properly evacuate an extremely overcrowded train in a timely manner.  I then was told I was not eligible for a refund. These vampire corporate bloodsuckers have no shame in taking a hard working person's money and not giving a damn about their commitments to services offered . I will most certainly be filing a complaint with the Transportation Board. Caveat emptor.

PS--dont need an insincere, bs apology, Anna, or anyone else working for this train "service". Don't need excuses either. Save your breath, please.

items.title: Worse service ever
items.review_text:
As always TFW give a terrible service. Train from Colwyn bay to Chester was full so they put on a bus which we got on. Next stop was Rhyl where the bus become full and not enough seats. Get to Chester a hour late on a uncomfortable coach. This has a massive lock on event for the rest of the journey. 
Complain and they come up with the same old excuses of getting more carriages which never seem to come. What a joke

items.title: Easy to book and change tickets
items.review_text: This is based on a journey booked from north Wales to London. I booked via the TfW app, which was cheaper and easier than other train ticket companies. I had to change the day of my journey, and it was so easy to do. The train staff were helpful, and the journey was pleasant. Thanks

items.title: You can never trust this service and…
items.review_text:
You can never trust this service and plan a trip. always late or cancelled. 
Only good thing is the staffs are polite and helpful .

items.title: Always late/delayed/cancelled without…
items.review_text: Always late/delayed/cancelled without good explanation or good enough compensation. When a public service is all about money then you tend to lose credibility! Crap service, terrible trains that smell most of the time!

items.title: TFW excelled their poor standards
items.review_text: Really poor service yet again from TFW today. Even by their abysmal standards fhis was poor. Train from Shrewsbury to Gabowen was cancelled meaning a two hour wait for a replacement. On the return journey the same happened and we had to wait two hours for a replacement bus. Took ages with the last stop at Cardiff Central expecting to arrive at midnight. Three hours late. I am dreading going back to work once restrictions lift because it’s clear I’m going to be permanently late for meetings. If TFW had anything about them they’d give all passengers a refund today but they won’t. Their customer services will have a usual reply about how hard they strive etc etc. Getting past a joke a long time ago. They are so fortunate that Welsh Government simply don’t care about how well they deliver.

items.title: Covid spreaders
items.review_text:
So we paid for a ticket on Tuesday 11:03 saying on the app the time it’s quite, the train was full even on corridor( we didn’t have space to go through the door even)
We take the next one at 12:09 on the way to destination they cancelled that train even they move us in another train which was extra full as well everyone pushed to go in, to catch a seat (no more manners now) So imagine that with 2 small kids.
Not to say on every journey they are late. 
I don’t know how the competent authority allows them to sell tickets if they don’t have spaces. 
It’s a shame they do this even during COVID.

items.title: Horrible staff Horrible trains Horrible service
items.review_text:
Staff at your station in Colwyn bay are 
Rude, abusive and obnoxious
Who do they think they are? 
No help with my wheelchair getting off the train. 
Spoken to like I was dirt.
Man (David ) was not interested in my travel plans for later told me to see the lady in the ticket office. 
Went to the lady (Sarah) and got looked at like I was dirt on the sole of her shoe.eyes rolled at me and given a pamphlet to fill in.asked what it was got a eye roll again and told to just fill in and send it off.
Came back 2 hours later to be greeted by same staff members and yet another huff and puff routine when I asked for ramp to get on train.
Asked where the lift was and was just pointed in a general direction.
Lift smelt of urine and not very safe 
Borded my train to confronted with a smelling old thing that was crowded with people who had no regard for social distancing or consideration for mask wearing.
No conductor come to ask where I was going and no announcement whatsoever regarding covid restrictions. A complete shambles 
At least the staff in Chester were more reliable and considerate.
Maybe the staff in Colwyn Bay could learn a few things from their colleagues in Chester

items.title: What covid rules?
items.review_text:
Traveled with transport wales from crew to Chester 12.24pm .While on platform tanoi urging people to keep social distance.
. I'm afraid this only happened till we boarded the train.on a busy time train only had 2 carriages so inside it was like a cattle market everyone on top of each other.Also heater was full blast on  a nice day with most windows closed. 
 Felt very compromised and vulnerable.
2 carriages honestly?

items.title: TFW Carmarthen
items.review_text: TFW Carmarthen, well, what can I say other than SHAMEFULL. I bought and paid for a return train journey from Llanelli to Pembroke on the 17th Dec 2020 for me and my 11 year old daughter to visit family. Getting off the train in Carmarthen at 10:55, this is where the changeover takes place the security ask to see your tickets to which I show him. He then asks me to show him my family and friends card which I showed him, it had unknown to myself expired. After an awkward silence from him he asked me to follow him to the ticket office where I apologised to the lady explaining that I've not been on the train for a while due to Covid/delays/cancellations etc and I was more than happy to pay the extra that the train fare would cost, 1/3rd. She was not at all helpful and said that I would have to pay in full my journey from Llanelli to Pembroke even though I'd already paid £15 for what is normally a £23 standard fare. My 11 year old daughter was now pulling at me asking to leave, crying and both the lady at the counter and guard were very unemotional/cold. Rather than cause her any more emotional trauma I said I couldn't afford the extra cost and said to both staff we would have to catch a bus home, my daughter had £10 spending money which I had to use to catch a bus back to Llanelli. The guard escorted me and my daughter out to the gate and watched us walk up the hill leading to the main road in Carmarthen. So, anyone reading this will agree, Shocking is an understatement of me and my daughters treatment by the staff in Carmarthen railway Station.

items.title: An excellent service and lovely staff…
items.review_text: An excellent service and lovely staff to top off a good evening is good but....... One of my most recent journeys involving a class 150 wasn't as it seemed. The doors were rattling like mad and I thought they were going to fall off and flies, I think I accidentally swallowed one. I do also like the fact that there are new disabled accesible toilets. But still not fully refurbished but still keep up the good work.

items.title: Hi have been coming to wales my whole…
items.review_text:
Hi have been coming to wales my whole life I have been on the route from tywyn to pwllheli many times and have never had a proble. However today with lockdown eased slightly we took this route today, catching three trains. On the way we were not asked to see a ticket however on the way back from pwllheli to tywyn we were asked for our ticket, we explained that last night we had tried to purchase the tickets via the app but it wouldn't let us so we planned to pay on the train. The conductor explained that we had to get them on the app and was rather rude. Other people on the train had the same issue but was let off because that was the only way they accepted the payments for the ticket, there was nothing on the app saying they only accepted tickets online. 
Also the signs that are placed on the seats and what the staff say are very different, eending mixed messages. On the sign it says if you are from the same household you can sit together, but we got told we were not allowed which is understanding under the current circumstances but why does the signs send a different message?
Each conductors saying different things, the next train we got we were told we shouldn't get the train we should get a taxi as the train is only for key workers and essential travel. He saw we had shopping bags and mentioned there was no need to go all this way as there are shops in tywyn, (he too was rather aggressive) if this was the case the app needs to be updated regularly with updates on what we are supposed to do, or all conductors need to be told the same guidelines.

items.title: Regular traveller that’s not disappointed
items.review_text:
I regularly travel to Cardiff with Transport for Wales to visit friends and family. The timetable is more limited now and there have been occasional delays but that's understandable in the circumstances. However I have always found the staff are friendly are helpful and nothing is too much trouble. 

I will continue to use their services and would recommend!

items.title: Having always travelled with Transport…
items.review_text: Having always travelled with Transport for Wales, I was pleased to see that, even with the crisis going on at the moment, the trains were on time and the staff friendly. It’s comforting that a company is so organised with social distancing measures in place and plenty of sanitiser points.

items.title: I occasionally have to take the Cardiff…
items.review_text: I occasionally have to take the Cardiff to Swansea train for work and have been really worried about making the journey since the corona virus situation started. Yesterday I had to travel and was really impressed by the set up at the station. The trains were clean and I also managed to stick to social distancing at both the station and on the train. Thanks for putting my mind at rest and making the journey a lot less stressful than I thought it would be!

items.title: Hard to believe that it's possible to…
items.review_text:
Hard to believe that it's possible to build such a poor website in 2019. There were better booking sites back in 1999. It's full of bugs. 

And on the trains, the staff give you wrong information and are then antagonistic when you query it with them.

Increased services are a positive but there's a lot of work for TfW to do.

items.title: A Disgrace to Wales
items.review_text:
Grossly overcrowded. Filthy carriages. Cancelled services. Late trains. A senior management team that are as much use as a trap door on a life raft. Where shall I stop?
     Never mind. If what I've been told by one of the staff is correct they're on the verge of losing the franchise. Let's hope eh !

items.title: If there was a zero rating I would give…
items.review_text: If there was a zero rating I would give that. Absolute pants. TFW have done absolutely nothing since taking over, other than making things worse. Cancellations and long delays, staff/conductors are passive aggressive. As a company who clearly has NOT done their market research to KNOW what the on and off peak hours are. Paid for ticket In advance. Have complaint with Ombudsman who are doing absolutely nothing. Basically agreeing that it is acceptable to pay for a weekly ticket, when the trains are cancelled and no r'ment services, having to find alternative transportation in which you have to pay for AGAIN!! City commuters taking up the space on Valley lines, preventing others getting to their actual destination due to carriages exceeding capacity. Valley line commuters have to wait 20-30 mins for their service, city commuters have wait 10 mins!! Or have the option to walk!! Disgrace would be an understatement.

items.title: Just as bad as the last 10 years
items.review_text:
Last minute platform changes, 2 carriage trains, seat bookings not marked up, filthy toilets, trains terminating before final destination, filthy stations, filthy trains, especially toilets, delays. Maintenance issues forcing trains out of service.
No this isn't a description of train service India, it's transport for Wales

items.title: TFW worst train operator I’ve ever used, ever
items.review_text: Just travelled back from London to Abergavenny, first part with GWR was a pleasure, then for the final journey from Newport, with TFW, sheer hell, 16:35 cancelled, 17:04 a two car train, couldn’t get on as was full and rammed like cattle! How can one train operator be so good and TFW so so bad, TFW slogan “the journey starts here” please please change this to “TFW your journey to hell”

items.title: The train will terminate at Crewe- yet again
items.review_text:
Why do so many trains for Manchester terminate at Crewe !!!!! 
Travelled to Manchester in August on the 5.37 am train from Cardiff. It was held up between Abergavenny and Hereford for about 45 minutes, because of signalling problems, then proceeded at a reduced speed.

They terminated the service at Crewe, to make matters worse. The connecting train from Crewe was an hour late arriving and I eventually reached Manchester 2 hours late.

The return train,at 4.31 pm, was just a 2 (or 3) carriage train. Ridiculous at a main railway station at a peak travel time, and was dangerously over-crowded. 

Last year, when Arriva ran the trains, I caught the 6.50 am train from Cardiff to Manchester Airport, which had a problem with the windscreen wipers and also terminated at Crewe. 

Fortunately I'd allowed plenty of time to get to the airport, and despite arriving nearly 2 hours late, caught my plane.

items.title: Due to our train being terminated…
items.review_text: Due to our train being terminated whilst sat at the station platform I submitted a compensation claim form enclosing my tickets around a month ago and am still to receive any acknowledgement from the provider. Followed up with an email via their website and am yet to receive a response.

items.title: TFW how can you justify raising the…
items.review_text: TFW how can you justify raising the price of tickets from  £10.50 for a single ticket from Haverfordwest to Cardiff to the price of £19.50 (off peak) Also no cheaper to buy return ticket, its still £19.50 each way. The government are trying to get people to use public transport instead of their cars...where is the incentive?.  Come back Arriva Trains!

items.title: Should be titled “The F**king Worst”
items.review_text: If I could physically give it a worst review, I would. I have to catch this service to work each morning; 60% - 70% of the time it’s 5 - 7 mins late, with that average going to 50/50 when taking the train home. I write this review after it being late again this morning; although they've re-branded with the goal to improve, it seams like they have only gotten worst. It doesn’t seam like they truly care about making people late every morning, and show no indication of changing their crappy service anytime soon. They either need to start scrapping the trains that keep breaking down or start firing the staff that impact on these delays, because experiencing this everyday is unacceptable. It’s become a running bad joke.

items.title: Deserves 0 stars
items.review_text: Deserves 0 stars. Travelling from Swansea to Chester. They decided to hijack the train schedule due to another train's broken doors, completely overpopulating the train. Terrible communication, caused huge delays and no sympathy from staff. Subsequent replacement trains also cancelled without informing us. Dirty, smelly trains with no charging points and broken toilet doors and toilets FULL of urine because the flush was broken. Awful experience, avoid unless absolutely necessary.

items.title: Travelled in November with TFW
items.review_text:
Travelled in November with TFW, what a farce. Chaotic is an understatement nobody would tell you anything unless you asked for info as to what's going on. No announcements etc. 
Wrote a letter of complaint, still waiting for an answer!!

items.title: Transport for Wales is the worst company I’ve ever seen
items.review_text:
A company that has no idea how to run a company!

So, where do I start? There is so many things to say!
Everything I am about to type is from the take over to now so less than half a year basically. 

So, first instance I’ve had with these is a cancelled train which caused me to be late for work!
Second instance the train was delayed by a whopping 35mins! So I made a complaint and the response I got was “that is not one of our trains” which is ludicrous because I bought a ticket and it shown up as Transport for Wales and even the guy who served the ticket said when people kicked off for being delayed for so long, so I deleted the email because of the brainless reply. 

Then one day I am heading home for work, finished at a great time to get home and spend time with the kids before bedtime, did I get home in time? Hell no! I left work at 18:00, the train journey is 22mins! I got home for 21:00! Figure that out and this was because we got into Cardiff central, the driver gets off and people sat there for about 45mins before someone came and told us this train is cancelled as we have no driver and we have to move platforms, this happened more than once baring in mind!

The time telling I find amusing, this company cannot tell the time! Here is a great example apart from being late on a daily basis! 

Now, the train is due at 09:50, the digital board says ON TIME, the time shows 10:20, so how is it on time then? This happens a lot, I am not joking, every time in the morning this is 100% the issue. 

So I pay £70.70 a month for my train ticket, I have made multiple complaints and I got a refund for the grand amazing total of £1.80! I seen it and laughed so much I now have a bad chest because that is hilarious. 

Oh this is a good one. I like to listen to music on the way to and from work. I cannot when on the trains anymore due to, getting the train from my location which I know goes to the stop I want to get off, to 90% of the time stopping in Cardiff central to go to a totally different f**ing place because of whatever reason. So why the hell does this train have the places I want to go before we all have to swap and I’ve seen this so many times a mass off people get off and get back onto a different train. Useless. 

Oh, the two carriages first thing in the morning for a train rammed with so many people is amusing. Brainless is the wrong word I would say because it’s amusing to see this company setup to fail. 

This company is a joke and beyond anything I’ve ever seen. Heck Arriva trains had some issues but this company has raised the bar and then destroyed the bar because the sky is not the limit for these guys. 

Cancelled trains, delayed trains and stopping mid travel to wait and swap because of whatever issue they have. Is a joke.
